festival.introText:
Abandon Silence and 24 Kitchen Street present

Baltic Weekender

The festival takes over the Baltic Triangle with another mega line up of house, techno, grime, bass music and everything in between with an array of headliners combined with the finest local selectors.
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Baltic Weekender. Get Baltic Weekender tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Baltic Weekender After Dark
Review of Baltic Weekender 2022
reviews.body: Great event. Good music styles. Great vibe. Good DJâ??s

reviews.title: Review of Baltic Weekender 2022
reviews.body: Half the acts we wanted to see where cancelled the day before. And acts that where meant to be on Friday where moved to Saturday. Communication from organisers was awful. So disappointed.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available?
faqs.answer: No Payment Plan tickets are currently available for this event.

faqs.question: Disabled Access Information
faqs.answer:
Personal Assistant / Essential Companion Information:

For this event, we're using the Skiddle Access Scheme by offering Personal Assistant tickets for customers who need to be accompanied. A Personal Assistant ticket is to be offered for free or discounted when somebody with a disability requires a carer to be in attendance with them. To automatically be eligible, please provide a copy of one of the following pieces of documentation listed below.

- Front page of DLA / PIP (no specific rate)
- Front page of Attendance Allowance letter (no specific rate)
- Evidence that registered severely sight impaired (blind)
- Recognised Assistance Dog ID card
- Credability's Access Card

If this applies to you then, please book the tickets you require (not including the Personal Assistant ticket) and contact the Skiddle Customer Care team with your documentation along with your 16-digit order reference number by submitting a support request here: https://help.skiddle.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

faqs.question: Does Baltic Weekender have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Baltic Weekender is a non camping festival. It is however close to the City Centre so there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: When is Baltic Weekender 2023?
faqs.answer: Baltic Weekender returns to Liverpool's Baltic Triangle on Friday 2nd - Saturday 3rd June 2023.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Baltic Weekender?
faqs.answer: Baltic Weekender is located in the Baltic Triangle in Liverpool. The postcode is L1 0BS.

faqs.question: What are the entry times for The Baltic Weekender?
Does Baltic Weekender have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Baltic Weekender. You may be asked to show photo ID.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Baltic Weekender After Dark
Review of Baltic Weekender 2021
reviewsDisplayFour.body: A little cheeky charging for after dark tickets despite the weekend continuing later on previous years, but other than that no complaints; music was good and venues were even better

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Baltic Weekender 2021
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Best event Iâ??ve been too in a long time, so much variety and the nicest of people!
